de.uni.bamberg.wiai.minf.forflow.datagenerator.controller.datageneration.unit
Interface ObservableUnit

All Known Subinterfaces:
Controller, WeightAndMeasurement, WeightAndMeasurementCustomized
All Known Implementing Classes:
ControllerImpl, Currency, Length, Mass, Math, Miscellaneous, Temperature, Time
public interface ObservableUnit

To be able to update the weight and measurements whenever a change in the data structure happens, we use Observer Pattern to get the desired effect.

Observer Pattern
This helps to get an update only, when things change and we get rid off of annoying pings.

Observer defines a one-to-many dependency between objects, so that when one object changes state, all its dependents are notified and updated automatically.

This defines the subject to observe. It's possible that more objects (observers) observe a subject (observable). But there's always only one subject to observe. That's the one-to-many dependency. Many observers, but one subject.

Since:
Apr/24/09
Version:
0.1
Author:
Michael Munz

Method Summary

          Here's the fun part; this is where we tell all observers about the state.

          When an observer registers, we just add it to the end of an observer list.
 void removeObserverUnit(ObserverUnit observer, java.lang.String name)
          Likewise, when an observer wants to un-register, we just take it off the list.
 

Method Detail

registerObserverUnit

void registerObserverUnit(ObserverUnit observer,
                          java.lang.String name)
When an observer registers, we just add it to the end of an observer list.

Parameters:
observer - an object to notify when an change occurs.
name - the name of an unit to register to.

removeObserverUnit

void removeObserverUnit(ObserverUnit observer,
                        java.lang.String name)
Likewise, when an observer wants to un-register, we just take it off the list.

Parameters:
observer - an object which doesn't want any notifications anymore.
name - the name of an unit to remove observer.

notifyObserverUnit

void notifyObserverUnit()
Here's the fun part; this is where we tell all observers about the state. Because they are all Observers, we know they all implement update(), so we know how to notify them.
